text:
Miners had chance to answer audit findings: DENR ABS-CBN News Posted at Feb 09 2017 09:49 AM 
Share Facebook 
MANILA – Mining companies replied to results of an industry-wide audit before they were ordered shut or suspended, the Department of Environment and Natural Resources said Thursday. 
Individual notices on the closures and suspensions were signed and released late Wednesday, undersecretary for legal affairs Maria Paz Luna told DZMM. READ: Lopez says miners will get individual reports “soonest” 
The Chamber of Mines had pressed the DENR for copies of the order, saying they were not aware of the basis for Environment Secretary Gina Lopez’s move. 
The mining companies’ replies to the “show cause” orders formed part of Lopez’s decision last week to close 23 mines and suspend five others, Luna said. 
“Nakapagcomply sila lahat ng magsubmit ng compliance report sa show cause,” Luna said. 
(All of them complied when they submitted reports on the show-cause order.) 
“Tambak-tambak na papales ang pinadala ng minahan sa amin, kahon-kahon po yun sa aming mga opisina,” she said. 
(We received piles upon piles of documents, boxes filled with documents in our office.)
